intro: Hieracium tortifrons, commonly known as the bent-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has alternate, often hairy leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium tortifrons is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
